summary: This is an independent financial condition report prepared by Macalvins Limited for Cohen & Gresser LLP, summarizing Ghislaine Maxwell's financial status from 2015 to 2020. It details her assets, liabilities, property transactions, and charitable activities, concluding her net worth was approximately $22.5 million as of October 2020. The report was prepared in the context of her criminal proceedings and addresses government allegations about financial transfers.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.role: Subject of the financial report, defendant in criminal proceedings
persons.context: The central subject of the financial condition report detailing her assets, net worth, property transactions, and financial activities from 2015 to 2020. She is noted as a defendant facing criminal charges.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in relation to government allegations of substantial financial transfers between his accounts and Ghislaine Maxwell's accounts during 2007-2011, and as the source of a foundation donation to her charity.

persons.name: Spouse of Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Married Ghislaine Maxwell in 2016; provided documentation and confirmation for the financial report; assets are commingled, and trusts were established involving him.

persons.name: Sister of Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned as a co-controller, with Maxwell's spouse, of a trust into which Ghislaine Maxwell transferred the majority of her assets in 2016.

connections.description: The report references government allegations of transfers totaling over $20 million between Epstein's accounts and Maxwell's accounts during 2007-2011, and notes Maxwell acted as an officer for Epstein-related corporate entities.
Married in 2016, filed joint tax returns, and commingled assets. Maxwell transferred the majority of her assets into a trust controlled by her spouse and her sister.
Co-controller, with Maxwell's spouse, of a trust holding the majority of Ghislaine Maxwell's assets after a 2016 transfer.

events.title: Sale of New York City Property
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell sold a residential property at 116 East 65th Street, New York, NY for $15,075,000. The proceeds were deposited into a UBS account of 116 E 65th LLC.

events.title: Marriage and Asset Transfer to Trust
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell married her spouse and transferred the majority of her assets into a trust controlled by her spouse and her sister.

events.title: Dissolution of Terramar Charities
events.description: Terramar Project Inc (US) and Terramar UK Ltd, charities founded by Ghislaine Maxwell, ceased operations and were dissolved.

events.title: Bail Hearing
events.description: The Government made allegations at a bail hearing regarding Ghislaine Maxwell's financial transfers and described UBS as a 'Swiss Bank', which the report clarifies is a US subsidiary.

events.title: Net Worth Assessment
events.description: The report estimates Ghislaine Maxwell and her spouse's combined net worth to be approximately $22,500,000, including about $7.67 million in advance legal retainer fees.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's net worth was approximately $20.2 million in January 2015 and estimated at $22.5 million in October 2020.
In 2015, she sold a New York City property for over $15 million, with proceeds tracked through accounts and used partly to purchase other properties.
After marrying in 2016, she transferred the majority of her assets into a trust controlled by her spouse and her sister.

The report addresses and disputes government allegations of suspicious financial transfers between Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein, stating no such transfers were found in the 2015-2020 period under review.
The report was prepared under constraints including limited access to some bank records due to closed accounts and Maxwell's detention, relying partly on information provided by her spouse.
